meanings.definition: To reduce to small particles by rubbing or grinding.
meanings.sent1: She was griding the spices in the mortar and pestle.
meanings.sent2: The chef was griding the coffee beans for the morning brew.
meanings.sent3: The kids were griding the crayons into colorful dust for their art project.
meanings.sent4: The old millstone kept griding away, turning wheat into flour.
meanings.sent5: The sound of griding pepper filled the kitchen with a spicy aroma.

meanings.sent1: The farmer was griding the wheat at the mill.
meanings.sent2: The waterwheel turned, griding the grains into flour.
meanings.sent3: The old miller loved griding the grains and hearing the rumble of the mill.
meanings.sent4: The ancient windmill stood tall, griding the corn with each gust of wind.
meanings.sent5: The rhythmic sound of the millstones griding was soothing to the villagers.

meanings.definition: To sharpen or shape by grinding.
meanings.sent1: The blacksmith was griding the blade of the sword to perfection.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter carefully griding the wood to create a smooth finish.
meanings.sent3: The sculptor enjoyed griding the marble into intricate shapes.
meanings.sent4: The sharpener was griding the knife, making it razor-sharp.
meanings.sent5: The sparks flew as the metalworker was griding the edges of the iron bars.
